item.title: Python
item.description: This blog is a brief review on using re.findall() with multiple matches. The go docs provide more details. Re.findall() Function The re.findal() function is an excellent tool in Python to look for and return all instances of a certain result in a string or list. There are special symbols and characters that can be used to return different results. Some examples of these symbols will be shown below. The “.” symbol The “.
